label: descriptiveness
task: For each of the statements below, please indicate how true each statement is for you. Response options: Never or very rarely true (1); Rarely true (2); Sometimes true (3); Often true (4); and Very often or always true (5). Respond only with the predicted class [(1), (2), (3), (4), (5)].

questions.content: I usually laugh or joke around with other people.
If I am feeling depressed, I can usually not cheer myself up with humor.
If someone makes a mistake, I will seldom tease them about it.
I do not let people laugh at me or make fun at my expense more than I should.
I have to work very hard at making other people laughâ€”I do not seem to be a naturally humorous person.
Even when I'm by myself, I'm rarely amused by the absurdities of life.
People are always offended or hurt by my sense of humor.
I will rarely get carried away in putting myself down if it makes my family or friends laugh.
I often make other people laugh by telling funny stories about myself.
If I am feeling upset or unhappy I usually do not try to think of something funny about the situation to make myself feel better.
When telling jokes or saying funny things, I am usually very concerned about how other people are taking it.
I rarely try to make people like or accept me more by saying something funny about my own weaknesses, blunders, or faults.
I do not laugh and joke a lot with my closest friends.
My humorous outlook on life does not keep me from getting overly upset or depressed about things.
I like it when people use humor as a way of criticizing or putting someone down.
I often say funny things to put myself down.
I usually like to tell jokes or amuse people.
If I'm by myself and I'm feeling unhappy, I do not make an effort to think of something funny to cheer myself up.
Sometimes I think of something that is funny, but I can stop myself from saying it if it is not appropriate for the situation.
I rarely go overboard in putting myself down when I am making jokes or trying to be funny.
I do not enjoy making people laugh.
If I am feeling sad or upset, I usually do not lose my sense of humor.
I always participate in laughing at others, especially if all my friends are doing it.
When I am with friends or family, I rarely seem to be the one that other people make fun of or joke about.
I often joke around with my friends.
It is my experience that thinking about some amusing aspect of a situation is often not a very effective way of coping with problems.
If I don't like someone, I rarely use humor or teasing to put them down.
If I am having problems or feeling unhappy, I rarely cover it up by joking around, so that even my closest friends don't know how I really feel.
I usually can think of witty things to say when I'm with other people.
I need to be with other people to feel amused - I can usually can't find things to laugh about even when I'm by myself.
If something is really funny to me, I will laugh or joke about it, even if someone will be offended.
Letting others laugh at me is not my way of keeping my friends and family in good spirits.
